summary: Serialization fails when a DTO class has a nullable array property (?array). The marshaller throws an InvalidArgumentException when null is passed instead of properly handling the nullable type.
userImpact: Developers cannot use DTOs with nullable array properties in workflow/activity arguments, forcing workarounds or restructuring their data models.
rootCause: ArrayType.parse() does not handle null values for nullable array types (?array), always expecting a valid array.
resolutionDetails: Fixed via PR #245 which was merged to handle nullable array types in serialization.
keyQuote: When developer using class as DTO with public properties to pass values to workflow with property type `?array` it got an error
